data.title: Remove atom-bot access token
data.body:
:warning: work in progress :warning:

We probably shouldn't ship with the atom bot token

data.title: Improve generated editor docs
data.body:
This PR does the following:
- Adds complete and correct documentation to all public methods on `Editor`
- Privatizes methods on `Editor` that we can all agree on. Kept a few methods private that need to be changed to handle multiple cursors.
- Renames `::joinLine` to `::joinLines`
- Removes metaprogrammed delegators for a few methods that need documentation.
- Make `::unfoldBufferRow` destroy all folds containing the given row, which I think would be the expected behavior.

Can you guys take a look and feel free to merge it in if you think it's ready? I think it's a big improvement overall.

data.title: Errors running atom tests on the CLI
data.body:
@jglovier reported the following problem running apm as installed by Atom. I'm not sure what's going on, but I'm wondering if we're trying to run apm with a system-installed Node but loading a version of `keytar` that's compiled against atom-shell's Node?

```
joels-air:~ joelglovier$ apm help publish

/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/keytar/node_modules/bindings/bindings.js:83
        throw e
              ^
Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 11, got 13.
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:312:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:364:17)
    at require (module.js:380:17)
    at bindings (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/keytar/node_modules/bindings/bindings.js:76:44)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/keytar/lib/keytar.js:4:31)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/keytar/lib/keytar.js:58:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:456:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:474:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
```

data.title: Don't export fs and _
data.body:
Packages are now directly depending on these via their `package.json` so they can be safely removed from the main `atom` exports object.

Closes #1479

data.title: Can we go back to the orange icon?
data.body:
I was talking to @dgraham and we both really miss the old orange icon. The green color just looks a bit meek and much harder to notice than the orange.

What was the reason for the change again? If it's fears about conflicting with GitHub chat, those are moot now since the project was cancelled.

- go to end of line, hit return and insert a `}` 
- Break!

data.title: Prefer 'organization' over 'org'
data.body: Per the Style Guide @ https://github.com/styleguide/words.

data.title: Locking up.
data.body:
Atom locks up a number of times per day for me. Oh man is it frustrating.

This might be hard to reproduce, but it's pretty consistent for me with these steps. I have no idea if any of these things actually contribute, but do them.
1. Open a repo with a bunch of markdown and an edited file. 
2. cmd+t an edited markdown file with long lines
3. cmd+p -> soft wrap
4. edit the file a bit
5. click on another file in the tree view to open it
6. Freeze!

You might have to edit -> click to open -> close the file -> click to open a few times to get it to happen.

data.title: Any method with a comment is added to the public API
data.body: I'm not sure if this is an Atom or Biscotto error, but any method with a comment is put into the public API. For example: [Project::eachEditor](https://github.com/github/atom/blob/v0.51.0/src/project.coffee#L326) is in the [API docs](https://atom.io/docs/api/v0.51.0/api/classes/Project.html#eachEditor-instance).

data.title: @nathansobo the Markdown Preview Buffer is awesome...now that I know I can use it. However, it would
data.body:
@nathansobo the Markdown Preview Buffer is awesome...now that I know I can use it. However, it would be the most awesomest if I could resize it. By that I mean make the line between the two adjustable, so I could reduce the percentage of the screen it takes up. Even better would be to have the option to hide it behind my working tab, so I can just flip back and forth between the two.  One "easy" change would be to make the background of the preview tab more yellow.  The black/white contrast is pretty hard on the old peepers. :heart:

data.title: Syntax parsing gets tricked on some values
data.body: For example, in this LESS file, take `overflowElipsis` for instance. It should be wrapped with `span.property-name`, but is getting parsed as: ``` overflowElipsis ``` ![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1319791/2223466/ae802bd6-9a72-11e3-9739-3d24af90080a.png) The result is that syntax highlighting doesn't work right. There are a few other instances I've caught: - text-overflow should be wrapped in .property-name, but gets broken into `span.property-value + span.operator + span.property-name` - `100%` as a property value should all be wrapped in span.constant.numeric, and ideally the span around `%` should be a child, but instead they are siblings (granted, that one might be a bit idealistic)

data.title: Atom should fail gracefully if `core.themes` references a theme that doesn't exist
data.body: I advised @jglovier to move his in-progress theme out of `~/.atom/packages` when debugging an issue, but the config still pointed at the theme he was working on. This caused Atom to raise an exception.

data.title: Use CoffeeScript literal syntax to reference methods in docs
data.body:
This PR uses and updated version of Biscotto (atom/biscotto#27) that interprets method references as follows:
- `Foo.bar` is a class method
- `Baz::quux` is an instance method

This blends in cleanly with the CoffeeScript literal syntax and brings much joy. The new syntax is used both in the interpretation of `{}` links in method comments and in the generated docs.

data.body: Just want to double check this and make sure it still works as it has broken in the past.

data.title: Show featured packages
data.body:
Updates apm and settings-view to be able to show featured packages/themes and search.

New apm commands
- `apm featured` to see the featured packages/themes
- `apm view <package_name>` to see info for a specific package
- `apm search <query>` to search for packages/themes

data.title: Remove File/Directory exports
data.body:
Packages now directly depend on `pathwatcher` to obtain `File` and `Directory` classes.

Follow on to #1553
